summary:
• The Afghanistan War Commission has opened an inquiry into America's longest-running conflict.
• This investigation aims to shed light on various aspects of the war, including its impact on civilians and military personnel.
• The commission seeks to learn from past mistakes and inform future policy decisions related to the region.

• The death toll in Bangladesh has surpassed 100 amid ongoing anti-government protests.
• A nationwide curfew has been imposed to restore order, with authorities citing public safety concerns.
• Dhaka city has fallen silent under the new curfew regulations.

• Keanu Reeves talks openly about his thoughts on mortality
• He believes people should consider their own deaths regularly
• This mindset helps him appreciate life and focus on positive experiences

• A Chinese actor was allegedly kidnapped and forced to work at an internet scam operation.
• The actor was reportedly held captive in a compound where he was made to participate in online fraud schemes.
• Authorities have launched an investigation into the incident and are working to rescue the actor and bring those responsible to justice.

• Six people were shot dead at a nursing home in Croatia.
• The incident occurred on an unspecified date and time.
• Authorities have launched an investigation into the tragedy.

• A boat carrying at least 40 Haitian migrants caught fire
• The incident resulted in the deaths of all on board
• Emergency services were unable to reach the stricken vessel

• A boy has died due to the Nipah virus in Kerala.
• This incident has raised concerns about public health safety in India.
• Health officials are working to identify any potential cases related to the outbreak.

• Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu must navigate complex US relations.
• Destruction and fear prevail along the Israel-Lebanon border.
• Israel has evacuated parts of Gaza and faced international criticism.

• Police use excessive force against protesters in Kenya.
• Protests turn violent due to police actions.
• Demonstrations continue despite government efforts to suppress them.

• A Tanzanian minister was fired due to allegations of poll rigging.
• The minister made controversial comments about election fraud.
• This development has sparked concerns about democratic values in the country.

• People in the city believe Russia needs to defeat Ukraine and the West at all costs.
• This suggests that there is strong support for Russian actions in the region.
• The level of determination expressed by these individuals may indicate a willingness to take drastic measures to achieve their goals.

• 57 Bangladeshi nationals jailed in UAE for protesting against their own government.
• The individuals were arrested after participating in demonstrations against the Bangladeshi government.
• This development has sparked concerns about human rights abuses in both countries.

• The world's longest rowing boat will be carrying the Olympic torch.
• This historic event marks a significant milestone in the Olympic torch relay.
• The iconic vessel is set to make history with this unique and challenging endeavor.

• Kamala Harris may have what it takes to defeat Trump.
• A significant number of devices are back online after an outage according to CrowdStrike.
• Biden told staff that quitting the race was the right decision.
• Lawmakers are calling on the US Secret Service boss to step down.
• There are six swing states that will determine the winner of the 2024 election.

• The Venezuelan president has been accused of being an autocrat
• Many have tried to run against him but he won’t allow it
• It is difficult to run against someone who doesn’t allow opponents

• Yemen's Houthis claim responsibility for a drone strike near the US embassy branch in Tel Aviv.
• The attack is believed to have been carried out using a small unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV).
• This incident marks an escalation of tensions between Houthi rebels and the United States.
